title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.2: COMMUNITIES' IMPROVED ACCESS TO Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2024, communities demonstrate and maintain improved access to safe Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in rural and urban areas., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children and their families in selected rural and urban areas, including in humanitarian settings, live in a climate- resilient environment and use safe and sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, communities demonstrate and maintain improved access to safe WASH services in rural and urban areas.

description.narrative: The WASH section focused on improving access to WASH in health facilities and schools. Considering the importance of person-to-person transmission in crowded public places a hand hygiene pilot project was initiated. A gravity flow system, river catchment and treatment systems were installed and the WASH response to the Nyiragongo volcano eruption and the Ebola and Cholera outbreak resulted in longer term improvement of the water quality plan in peri-urban areas. The Urban, Climate, Adolescent and Nexus strategies were finalized with important WASH components. The operationalization of the Open Defecation Free roadmap was launched in Kasai Occidental and North Kivu provinces. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
